name: zero_add
statement: theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
proof:
theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
  induction n with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ, ih]

name: succ_add
statement: theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b)  := by
proof:
theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b) := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero, add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ, add_succ, ih]

name: add_comm
statement: theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by
proof:
theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by

  | zero =>
    rw [zero_add]
    rw [add_zero]
  | succ k ih =>
    rw [succ_add]
    rw [add_succ]
    rw [ih]

name: two_plus_two_ne_five
statement: theorem two_plus_two_ne_five : add (succ (succ zero)) (succ (succ zero)) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) := by
proof:
theorem two_plus_two_ne_five : add (succ (succ zero)) (succ (succ zero)) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) := by
  -- Compute add two two step-by-step
  rw [add_succ, add_succ, add_zero]
  -- Now the LHS is succ (succ (succ (succ zero))) = four
  -- The RHS is succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) = five
  -- We need to show four ≠ five
  intro h
  -- Unfold five as succ four
  have h1 : succ (succ (succ (succ zero))) = succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) := h
  -- Apply succ_inj repeatedly to reduce the equality
  rw [← four_eq_succ_three] at h1
  apply succ_inj at h1
  rw [← three_eq_succ_two] at h1
  apply succ_inj at h1
  rw [← two_eq_succ_one] at h1
  apply succ_inj at h1
  rw [← one_eq_succ_zero] at h1
  apply succ_inj at h1
  -- Now we have zero = succ zero, which contradicts zero_ne_succ
  exact zero_ne_succ zero h1

statement: theorem one_mul (m : MyNat) : mul one m = m := by
proof:

  induction m with
  | zero =>
    rw [mul_zero]

name: le_antisymm
statement: theorem le_antisymm (x y : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyx : le y x) : x = y := by
proof:
theorem le_antisymm (x y : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyx : le y x) : x = y := by
  cases hxy with | intro c hc =>
  cases hyx with | intro d hd =>
  rw [hd] at hc
  rw [add_assoc] at hc
  have h : add d c = zero := by
    apply add_right_eq_self
    exact hc
  have hd_zero : d = zero := by
    apply add_right_eq_zero a := d b := c
    exact h
  have hc_zero : c = zero := by
    apply add_left_eq_zero a := d b := c
    exact h
  rw [hd_zero, add_zero] at hd
  exact hd.symm

name: le_total
statement: theorem le_total (x y : MyNat) : (le x y) ∨ (le y x) := by
proof:
theorem le_total (x y : MyNat) : (le x y) ∨ (le y x) := by
  induction x with
  | zero =>
    left
    apply zero_le
  | succ d ih =>
    cases y with
    | zero =>
      right
      apply zero_le
    | succ e =>
      cases ih e with
      | inl h =>
        left
        cases h with
        | intro c hc =>
          use c
          rw [add_succ, hc]
      | inr h =>
        right
        cases h with
        | intro c hc =>
          use c
          rw [add_succ, hc]

name: le_one
statement: theorem le_one (x : MyNat) (hx : le x one) : x = zero ∨ x = one := by
proof:
theorem le_one (x : MyNat) (hx : le x one) : x = zero ∨ x = one := by
  rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hx
  cases hx with | intro c hc =>
    cases x with
    | zero =>
      left
      rfl
    | succ d =>
      right
      rw [one_eq_succ_zero] at hc
      rw [succ_add] at hc
      apply succ_inj at hc
      have h := add_right_eq_zero d c hc
      cases h with
      | intro hd hc =>
        rw [hd]
        rfl

name: le_two
statement: theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
proof:
theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
  rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hx
  cases hx with | intro c hc =>
    induction x with
    | zero =>
      left
      rfl
    | succ d ih =>
      cases c with
      | zero =>
        rw [add_zero] at hc
        right
        right
        exact hc
      | succ k =>
        rw [add_succ] at hc
        apply succ_inj at hc
        cases k with
        | zero =>
          rw [add_zero] at hc
          right
          left
          rw [← one_eq_succ_zero, ← hc]
          rfl
        | succ m =>
          rw [add_succ] at hc
          apply succ_inj at hc
          cases m with
          | zero =>
            rw [add_zero] at hc
            left
            exact hc
          | succ n =>
            contradiction

name: mul_le_mul_right
statement: theorem mul_le_mul_right (a b t : MyNat) (h : le a b) : le (mul a t) (mul b t) := by
proof:
theorem mul_le_mul_right (a b t : MyNat) (h : le a b) : le (mul a t) (mul b t) := by
  -- Unpack the hypothesis `le a b` to get `c` such that `b = add a c`
  cases h with | intro c hc =>
  -- Rewrite `b` as `add a c` in the goal
  rw [hc]
  -- Apply the `add_mul` theorem to expand `mul (add a c) t`
  rw [add_mul]
  -- Now we need to show `le (mul a t) (add (mul a t) (mul c t))`
  -- By definition of `le`, we need to find `d` such that `add (mul a t) (mul c t) = add (mul a t) d`
  -- We can take `d = mul c t`
  use (mul c t)
  -- The equality holds by reflexivity
  rfl

name: one_le_of_ne_zero
statement: theorem one_le_of_ne_zero (a : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) : le one a := by
proof:
theorem one_le_of_ne_zero (a : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) : le one a := by
  -- Get n such that a = succ n
  cases eq_succ_of_ne_zero a ha with
  | intro n hn =>
    -- Rewrite a as succ n
    rw [hn]
    -- Rewrite succ n as add n one
    rw [succ_eq_add_one]
    -- Use commutativity to get add one n
    rw [add_comm]
    -- Now a = add one n, so le one a holds with c = n
    use n
    rfl

name: le_mul_right
statement: theorem le_mul_right (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b ≠ zero) : le a (mul a b) := by
proof:
theorem le_mul_right (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b ≠ zero) : le a (mul a b) := by
  have hb : b ≠ zero := mul_left_ne_zero a b h
  cases eq_succ_of_ne_zero b hb with
  | intro k hk =>
    rw [hk, mul_succ]
    rw [add_comm]
    use (mul a k)
    rfl

name: mul_right_eq_one
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
proof:
theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
  cases x with
  | zero =>
    rw [zero_mul] at h
    contradiction
  | succ n =>
    cases y with
    | zero =>
      rw [mul_zero] at h
      contradiction
    | succ m =>
      rw [mul_succ] at h
      have h1 : add (mul (succ n) m) (succ n) = one := h
      cases m with
      | zero =>
        rw [mul_zero] at h1
        rw [add_zero] at h1
        rw [h1]
        rfl
      | succ k =>
        rw [mul_succ] at h1
        rw [add_assoc] at h1
        have h2 := add_left_eq_zero _ _ h1
        rw [is_zero_succ] at h2
        trivial

name: mul_ne_zero
statement: theorem mul_ne_zero (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (hb : b ≠ zero) : mul a b ≠ zero := by
proof:
theorem mul_ne_zero (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (hb : b ≠ zero) : mul a b ≠ zero := by
  -- Express a and b as successors since they're non-zero
  cases eq_succ_of_ne_zero a ha with
  | intro n hn =>
    cases eq_succ_of_ne_zero b hb with
    | intro m hm =>
      -- Rewrite a and b as successors
      rw [hn, hm]
      -- Now prove by induction on m that mul (succ n) (succ m) ≠ zero
      induction m with
      | zero =>
        -- Base case: mul (succ n) (succ zero) = succ n ≠ zero
        rw [mul_one]
        apply zero_ne_succ
      | succ k ih =>
        -- Inductive step: mul (succ n) (succ (succ k)) = add (mul (succ n) (succ k)) (succ n)
        rw [mul_succ, add_succ]
        -- The result is a successor, hence not zero
        apply zero_ne_succ

name: mul_eq_zero
statement: theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
proof:
theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
  cases a with
  | zero =>
    left
    rfl
  | succ n =>
    right
    induction b with
    | zero =>
      rfl
    | succ m ih =>
      rw [mul_succ] at h
      have h_add := add_eq_zero (mul (succ n) m) (succ n) h
      cases h_add with
      | intro h1 h2 =>
        have h_succ : succ n ≠ zero := by
          apply zero_ne_succ
        contradiction

name: mul_left_cancel
statement: theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
proof:
theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    cases mul_eq_zero a c h with
    | inl h1 => contradiction
    | inr h2 => exact h2
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    cases c with
    | zero =>
      rw [mul_zero] at h
      have h' := add_right_eq_zero (mul a d) a h
      contradiction
    | succ k =>
      rw [mul_succ] at h
      have h' := add_right_cancel (mul a d) (mul a k) a h
      rw [ih h']

name: mul_right_eq_self
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
proof:
theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    contradiction
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    rw [add_left_eq_self] at h
    have hd_zero := h
    cases mul_eq_zero a d hd_zero with
    | inl h1 => contradiction
    | inr h2 => rw [h2]
    rfl
